Pre-Game Insights: Houston will try to keep its three-game road win streak alive when the Rockets take on Washington.The Rockets are 10-6 on the road, averaging 111.2 points, 47.8 rebounds, 19.8 assists, 7.5 steals, and 4.8 blocks per game while shooting 44.8% from the field.The Wizards are 6-27, allowing 121.8 points per game, and have been outscored by 12.9 points per game.The Rockets average 11.8 made 3-pointers per game this season, while the Wizards allow 14.5 per game.Jordan Poole is averaging 21.8 points, five assists, and 1.6 steals for the Wizards.Alperen Sengun is averaging 18.8 points, 10.4 rebounds, and five assists for the Rockets.The Rockets have a 6-4 record in their last 10 games, averaging 108.6 points per game, while the Wizards have a 3-7 record in their last 10 games, averaging 112.1 points per game.The Wizards are dealing with injuries to Saddiq Bey, Jordan Poole, Marvin Bagley III, and Bilal Coulibaly.The Rockets have injuries to Jae'Sean Tate, Tari Eason, and Jabari Smith Jr.This is the 100th meeting between the two rival teams.
